paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR gene variants, including penetrance data and individual case details.

patients.demographics: mean age 44.9 years, mixed sex, primarily European, American, and Japanese patients
patients.phenotype: leptomeningeal amyloidosis with symptoms including cognitive impairment, headache, ataxia, seizures, and hearing loss

individual_records.phenotype_details: rapidly progressive cognitive decline, right-sided weakness, and numbness
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 27-year-old male presented with a 2-year history of progressive symptoms including cognitive decline and right-sided weakness and numbness.

functional_data.summary: The mutation c.113A>G (p.D38G) is predicted to be deleterious by SIFT and POLYPHEN2.

variants.segregation_data: The mutation segregates with disease in families, as seen in multiple reported cases.
variants.additional_notes: The c.113A>G mutation is the only one identified in China among the studied cases.
key_quotes: The only mutation founded in China is c.113A>G.
In our study, we found that c.113A>G is an early-onset variant.

tables_processed.table_caption: Mutations Reported Associated With Leptomeningeal Amyloidosis

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and tables.
